meanings.definition: A person who is skilled in the art of deception.
meanings.sent1: The sly lungan managed to fool everyone with his clever tricks.
meanings.sent2: She realized too late that the charming man was actually a lungan.
meanings.sent3: The lungan's ability to twist the truth made him the life of the party.
meanings.sent4: His smile was a mask, hiding the true intentions of the lungan.
meanings.sent5: Beware of the smooth-talking lungan, for his words are like shadows in the dark.

meanings.sent1: She tried to lungan her way out of trouble by spinning a tale of innocence.
meanings.sent2: He lunganed his friends into believing he had magical powers.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous child lunganed his little sister into thinking she could fly.
meanings.sent4: The con artist lunganed the old lady out of her life savings with a fake investment scheme.
meanings.sent5: The cunning fox lunganed the rabbit into coming closer with promises of friendship.

meanings.sent1: The innocent smile was just a lungan to hide his true intentions.
meanings.sent2: The luxurious mansion was a lungan for the financial troubles of its owner.
meanings.sent3: The elaborate costume was a lungan to blend in with the masquerade party.
meanings.sent4: Her beauty was a lungan that masked the darkness within her heart.
meanings.sent5: The peaceful facade of the town was a lungan for the corruption lurking beneath the surface.
